abstract.text: Find, load, and configure audio components, such as Audio Units and audio codecs.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use the Audio Components API to register and discover audio units, codecs, and other loadable code modules. This API replaces the Component Manager API used prior to macOS 10.6. The system searches for loadable bundles with a
filename extension in the following locations:
item whose value is an array of dictionaries. For example:

code: <!-- Or it can describe its resource usage. -->
<!-- An AudioComponent can define its tags. -->

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
An audio component.
Returns the generic name of an audio component.
Returns the number of audio components that match a specified
structure.
Identifying information for an audio component.
Finds the next component that matches a specified
structure after a specified audio component.
Gets the class description, as an
structure, of an audio component.
Gets the version of an audio component in hexadecimal form as
(major, minor, dot).
A component instance, or object, is an audio unit or audio codec.
Determines if an audio component instance implements a particular function.
Disposes of an audio component instance.
Retrieves a reference to an audio component from an instance of that audio component.
Creates a new instance of an audio component.
Obtain information about the built-in mixers, equalizers, filters, effects, and other Audio Unit app extensions.
Configure an Audio Unit and prepare it to render audio.
Deliver custom audio effects, instruments, and other audio behaviors using an Audio Unit v3 app extension.
Configure system voice processing and respond to speech events.
Convert 8-channel audio to 2-channel spatial audio by using a spatial mixer audio unit.

doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentati.title: Generating spatial audio from a multichannel audio stream
